content.text:
# Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel__disambig_1

Falls, Idaho Territory, in background. By Timothy H. O'Sullivan, 1868 ]]
The Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel was a geological survey made by order of the Secretary of War according to acts of Congress of March 2, 1867, and March 3, 1869, under the direction of Brig. and Bvt. Major General A. A. Humphreys, Chief of Engineers, by Clarence King, U. S. geologist. More commonly known as the Fortieth Parallel Survey, the survey conducted field work from 1867 to 1872, exploring the area along the fortieth parallel north from northeastern California, through Nevada, to eastern Wyoming.
Results
The results of the survey were published in eight volumes of the Fortieth Parallel Survey:
* [https://archive.org/details/reportofgeologic01unit Vol. I. Systematic geology], by Clarence King, U. S. Geologist. 1878. xii, 803 pp., and atlas of 12 sheets.
* [https://archive.org/details/descriptivegeolo00hagu Vol. II. Descriptive geology], by Arnold Hague and S. F. Emmons. 1877. xiii, 890 pp.
* [https://archive.org/details/reportofgeologic03unit Vol. III. Mining industry], by James Duncan Hague, with geological contributions by Clarence King. 1870. xv, 647 pp. and atlas of 14 sheets.
* [https://archive.org/details/reportofgeologic43unit Vol. IV]. Part I, Palaeontology. by F. B. Meek. Part II, Palaeontology, by James Hall and R. P. Whitfield. [https://archive.org/details/cu31924000092373 Part III, Ornithology], by Robert Ridgway. 1877. xii, 669 pp.
* [https://archive.org/details/mobot31753000619566 Vol. V. Botany], by Sereno Watson, aided by Prof. Daniel C. Eaton and others. 1871. liii, 525 pp.
* [https://archive.org/details/microscopicalpet00zirkuoft Vol. VI. Microscopical petrography], by Ferdinand Zirkel. 1876. xv, 297 pp.
* [https://archive.org/details/reportofgeologic07unit Vol. VII. Odontornithes], A monograph on the extinct toothed birds of North America, by Othniel Charles Marsh. 1880. xv, 201 pp.
* Special Publication: [https://archive.org/details/listplantscolle00watsgoog List of plants collected in Nevada and Utah, 1867-69]; numbered as distributed. Sereno Watson, collector.
Atlases:
* Atlas accompanying the report of the Geological Exploration of the Fortieth Parallel. by Clarence King, U. S. geologist-in-charge. 1876. Julius Bien, Lithographer. Folio, 2 11., (title and legend), 1 single and 11 double folio sheets (1 single folio map, 10 double folio maps, 1 double folio section).
* [https://archive.org/details/atlas_mining_industry00newy Atlas accompanying Volume III on Mining Industry]. [List of plates.] Engraved and printed by Julius Bien, New York. Folio, 11. (title page), 14 plates.
References
Additional Sources
*[https://web.archive.org/web/20120901092123/http://libraryphoto.cr.usgs.gov/cgi-bin/search.cgi?search_mode=noPunct&selection=King+Survey+%28U.S.G.S.+Expedition+of+the+40th+parallel%29%7CKing%7Cfortieth+parallel USGS Historical Photography Library] - Collection of photographs from the 40th Parallel Survey.
*[https://www.flickr.com/photos/agslibrary/albums/72157690486302942 Photos of volumes] - held at the American Geographical Society Library, UW Milwaukee.
